flixel.FlxG

type
class
This is a global helper class full of useful functions for audio, input, basic info, and the camera system among other things. Utilities for maths and color and things can be found in the util package. FlxG is specifically for Flixel-specific properties.

Static Variables

LIBRARY_MAJOR_VERSION : String

Assign a major version to your library. Appears before the decimal in the console.

LIBRARY_MINOR_VERSION : String

Assign a minor version to your library. Appears after the decimal in the console.

LIBRARY_NAME : String

If you build and maintain your own version of flixel, you can give it your own name here.

autoPause : Bool

Whether the game should be paused when focus is lost or not. Use FLX_NO_FOCUS_LOST_SCREEN if you only want to get rid of the default pause screen. Override onFocus() and onFocusLost() for your own behaviour in your state.

autoResize : Bool

Whether FlxG.resizeGame() should be called whenever the game is resized. False by default.

bitmap(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.BitmapFrontEnd

A reference to the BitmapFrontEnd object. Contains things related to bimtaps, for example regarding the bitmap cache and the cache itself.

camera : FlxCamera

By default this just refers to the first entry in the FlxG.cameras.list array but you can do what you like with it.

cameras(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.CameraFrontEnd

A reference to the CameraFrontEnd object. Contains things related to cameras, a list of all cameras and the defaultCamera amongst other things.

console(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.ConsoleFrontEnd

A reference to the ConsoleFrontEnd object. Use it to register functions and objects or add new commands to the console window.

debugger(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.DebuggerFrontEnd

A reference to the DebuggerFrontEnd object. Use it to show / hide / toggle the debguger change its layout, activate visual debugging or change the key used to toggle it.

elapsed : Float

Represents the amount of time in seconds that passed since last frame.

fixedTimestep : Bool

WARNING: Changing this can lead to issues with physcis and the recording system. Setting this to false might lead to smoother animations (even at lower fps) at the cost of physics accuracy.

flashFramerate(accessor,accessor) : Int

How many times you want your game to update each second. More updates usually means better collisions and smoother motion. NOTE: This is NOT the same thing as the Flash Player framerate!

framerate(accessor,accessor) : Int

How many times you want your game to update each second. More updates usually means better collisions and smoother motion. NOTE: This is NOT the same thing as the Flash Player framerate!

fullscreen(default,accessor) : Bool

Use this to toggle between fullscreen and normal mode.

game(default,null) : FlxGame

Internal tracker for game object.

height(default,null) : Int

The height of the screen in game pixels. Read-only, use resizeGame() to change.

inputs(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.InputFrontEnd

From here on: frontEnd classes.

keyboard(default,null) : flixel.system.input.keyboard.FlxKeyboard

A reference to a FlxKeyboard object. Important for input!

keys(default,null) : flixel.system.input.keyboard.FlxKeyShortcuts

A reference to a FlxKeyAccess object. Handy for quickly getting information about keys pressed / just pressed or just released!

libraryName(accessor,null) : String

The library name, which is "HaxeFlixel v.(major version).(minor version)"

log(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.LogFrontEnd

A reference to the LogFrontEnd object. Use it to add messages to the log window. It is recommended to use trace() instead of the old FlxG.log(), since traces will be redirected by default.

mouse(default,null) : flixel.system.input.mouse.FlxMouse

A reference to a FlxMouse object. Important for input!

paused : Bool

Handy shared variable for implementing your own pause behavior.

plugins(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.PluginFrontEnd

A reference to the PluginFrontEnd object. Contains a list of all plugins and the functions required to add(), remove() them etc.

save(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxSave

A FlxSave used internally by flixel to save sound preferences and the history of the console window, but no reason you can't use it for your own stuff too!

sound(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.SoundFrontEnd

A reference to the SoundFrontEnd object. Contains a list of all sounds and other things to manage or play() sounds.

stage(accessor,null) : flash.display.Stage

Read-only: retrieves the Flash stage object (required for event listeners) Will be null if it's not safe/useful yet.

state(accessor,null) : FlxState

Read-only: access the current game state from anywhere.

timeScale : Float

How fast or slow time should pass in the game; default is 1.0.

touches(default,null) : flixel.system.input.touch.FlxTouchManager

A reference to a FlxTouchManager object. Useful for devices with multitouch support

vcr(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.VCRFrontEnd

A reference to the VCRFrontEnd object. Contains all the functions needed for recording and replaying.

watch(default,null) : flixel.system.frontEnds.WatchFrontEnd

A reference to the WatchFrontEnd object. Use it to add or remove things to / from the watch window.

width(default,null) : Int

The width of the screen in game pixels. Read-only, use resizeGame() to change.

worldBounds(default,null) : flixel.util.FlxRect

The dimensions of the game world, used by the quad tree for collisions and overlap checks. Use .set() instead of creating a new object!

worldDivisions : Int

How many times the quad tree should divide the world on each axis. Generally, sparse collisions can have fewer divisons, while denser collision activity usually profits from more. Default value is 6.

Static Methods

inline collide(?ObjectOrGroup1 : FlxBasic, ?ObjectOrGroup2 : FlxBasic, ?NotifyCallback : Dynamic -> Dynamic -> Void) : Bool

parameters
ObjectOrGroup1 The first object or group you want to check.
ObjectOrGroup2 The second object or group you want to check. If it is the same as the first, flixel knows to just do a comparison within that group.
NotifyCallback A function with two FlxObject parameters - e.g. myOverlapFunction(Object1:FlxObject,Object2:FlxObject) - that is called if those two objects overlap.
returns
Whether any objects were successfully collided/separated.
Call this function to see if one FlxObject collides with another. Can be called with one object and one group, or two groups, or two objects, whatever floats your boat! For maximum performance try bundling a lot of objects together using a FlxGroup (or even bundling groups together!). This function just calls FlxG.overlap and presets the ProcessCallback parameter to FlxObject.separate. To create your own collision logic, write your own ProcessCallback and use FlxG.overlap to set it up. NOTE: does NOT take objects' scrollfactor into account, all overlaps are checked in world space.

overlap(?ObjectOrGroup1 : FlxBasic, ?ObjectOrGroup2 : FlxBasic, ?NotifyCallback : Dynamic -> Dynamic -> Void, ?ProcessCallback : Dynamic -> Dynamic -> Bool) : Bool

parameters
ObjectOrGroup1 The first object or group you want to check.
ObjectOrGroup2 The second object or group you want to check. If it is the same as the first, flixel knows to just do a comparison within that group.
NotifyCallback A function with two FlxObject parameters - e.g. myOverlapFunction(Object1:FlxObject,Object2:FlxObject) - that is called if those two objects overlap.
ProcessCallback A function with two FlxObject parameters - e.g. myOverlapFunction(Object1:FlxObject,Object2:FlxObject) - that is called if those two objects overlap. If a ProcessCallback is provided, then NotifyCallback will only be called if ProcessCallback returns true for those objects!
returns
Whether any overlaps were detected.
Call this function to see if one FlxObject overlaps another. Can be called with one object and one group, or two groups, or two objects, whatever floats your boat! For maximum performance try bundling a lot of objects together using a FlxGroup (or even bundling groups together!). NOTE: does NOT take objects' scrollfactor into account, all overlaps are checked in world space.

inline pixelPerfectOverlap(Sprite1 : FlxSprite, Sprite2 : FlxSprite, ?AlphaTolerance : Int, ?Camera : FlxCamera) : Bool

parameters
Sprite1 The first FlxSprite to test against
Sprite2 The second FlxSprite to test again, sprite order is irrelevant
AlphaTolerance The tolerance value above which alpha pixels are included. Default to 255 (must be fully opaque for collision).
Camera If the collision is taking place in a camera other than FlxG.camera (the default/current) then pass it here
returns
Boolean True if the sprites collide, false if not
A Pixel Perfect Collision check between two FlxSprites. It will do a bounds check first, and if that passes it will run a pixel perfect match on the intersecting area. Works with rotated and animated sprites. It's extremly slow on cpp targets, so I don't recommend you to use it on them. Not working on neko target and awfully slows app down

inline resetGame() : Void

Like hitting the reset button a game console, this will re-launch the game as if it just started.

inline resetState() : Void

Request a reset of the current game state.

inline resizeGame(Width : Int, Height : Int) : Void

Handy helper functions that takes care of all the things to resize the game. Use FlxG.autoResize to call this function automtically when the window is resized!

safeDestroy<T>(Object : Null<IDestroyable>) : T

parameters
Object An FlxBasic object that will be destroyed if it's not null.
returns
Null
Checks if an object is not null before calling destroy(), always returns null.

inline switchState(State : FlxState) : Void

Switch from the current game state to the one specified here.
